intro: Betula pubescens var. sibakademica, commonly known as the Siberian birch, is a variant of the silver birch native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its white, peeling bark and slender, often pendulous branches. The leaves are typically oval-shaped with serrated edges and a slightly hairy underside. It thrives in cool, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with moist, well-drained soils. This plant plays an important role in ecological systems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
